CommentsController GET #show assigns the comment as @comment
PublicationRequestsController GET #show assigns the publication_request as @publication_request
RequestAttachmentsController GET #show assigns the request_attachment as @request_attachment
StatusesController GET #show should assaign the requested status to @status
TemplatesController GET #show assigns the template as @template
UsersController GET #show assigns the requested user as @user
UsersController GET #show works with user_params too
CommentsController GET #index assigns all comments as @comments
PublicationRequestsController GET #index assigns all publication_requests as @publication_requests
RequestAttachmentsController GET #index assigns all request_attachments as @request_attachments
StatusesController GET #index should assign all statuses as @statuses
TemplatesController GET #index assigns all templates as @templates
UsersController GET #index assigns all users as @users
CommentsController POST #create with valid params creates a new Comment
CommentsController POST #create with valid params assigns a newly created comment as @comment
CommentsController PUT #update with valid params updates the requested comment
CommentsController PUT #update with valid params assigns the requested comment as @comment
PublicationRequestsController POST #create with valid params creates a new PublicationRequest
PublicationRequestsController POST #create with valid params assigns a newly created request as @publication_request
PublicationRequestsController POST #create with valid params should send 2 emails
PublicationRequestsController PUT #update with valid params updates the requested publication_request
PublicationRequestsController PUT #update with valid params assigns the requested publication_request as @publication_request
RequestAttachmentsController POST #create with valid params creates a new RequestAttachment
RequestAttachmentsController POST #create with valid params assigns a newly created attachment as @request_attachment
RequestAttachmentsController PUT #update with valid params updates the requested request_attachment
RequestAttachmentsController PUT #update with valid params assigns the requested request_attachment as @request_attachment
StatusesController POST #create with valid params should create a new Status
StatusesController POST #create with valid params should assign a newly created status as @status
StatusesController PUT #update with valid params updates the requested status
StatusesController PUT #update with valid params assigns the requested status as @status
TemplatesController POST #create with valid params creates a new Template
TemplatesController POST #create with valid params assigns a newly created template as @template
TemplatesController PUT #update with valid params updates the requested template
TemplatesController PUT #update with valid params assigns the requested template as @template
UsersController POST #create with valid params creates a new User
UsersController POST #create with valid params assigns a newly created user as @user
UsersController PUT #update with valid params updates the requested user
UsersController PUT #update with valid params assigns the requested user as @user
CommentsController POST #create with invalid params assigns a newly created but unsaved comment as @comment
CommentsController POST #create with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
CommentsController PUT #update with invalid params assigns the comment as @comment
CommentsController PUT #update with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
PublicationRequestsController POST #create with invalid params assigns a newly created but unsaved publication_request as @publication_request
PublicationRequestsController POST #create with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
PublicationRequestsController POST #create with invalid params should not send any emails
PublicationRequestsController PUT #update with invalid params assigns the publication_request as @publication_request
PublicationRequestsController PUT #update with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
RequestAttachmentsController POST #create with invalid params assigns a newly created but unsaved request_attachment as @request_attachment
RequestAttachmentsController POST #create with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
RequestAttachmentsController PUT #update with invalid params assigns the request_attachment as @request_attachment
RequestAttachmentsController PUT #update with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
StatusesController POST #create with invalid params assigns a newly created but unsaved status as @status
StatusesController POST #create with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
StatusesController PUT #update with invalid params assigns the status as @status
StatusesController PUT #update with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
TemplatesController POST #create with invalid params assigns a newly created but unsaved template as @template
TemplatesController POST #create with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
TemplatesController PUT #update with invalid params assigns the template as @template
TemplatesController PUT #update with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
UsersController POST #create with invalid params assigns a newly created but unsaved user as @user
UsersController POST #create with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
UsersController PUT #update with invalid params assigns the user as @user
UsersController PUT #update with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
CommentsController DELETE #destroy destroys the requested comment
CommentsController DELETE #destroy redirects to the comments list
PublicationRequestsController DELETE #destroy destroys the requested publication_request
PublicationRequestsController DELETE #destroy redirects to the publication requests list
RequestAttachmentsController DELETE #destroy destroys the requested request_attachment
RequestAttachmentsController DELETE #destroy redirects to the publication requests list
StatusesController DELETE #destroy destroys the requested status
StatusesController DELETE #destroy redirects to the statuses list
TemplatesController DELETE #destroy destroys the requested template
TemplatesController DELETE #destroy redirects to the publication requests list
UsersController DELETE #destroy destroys the requested user
UsersController DELETE #destroy redirects to the users list
PasswordResetsController POST #create with valid email should assign the user
PasswordResetsController POST #create with valid email should send an email
PasswordResetsController POST #create with valid email should respond with 204
PasswordResetsController POST #create with invalid email should not assign the user
PasswordResetsController POST #create with invalid email should not send an email
PasswordResetsController POST #create with invalid email should still respond with 204

testsuite.name: with valid token and valid password

testcase.name: PasswordResetsController PUT #update with valid token and valid password should assign the user
PasswordResetsController PUT #update with valid token and valid password should respond with 204

testsuite.name: with valid token but invalid password

testcase.name: PasswordResetsController PUT #update with valid token but invalid password should assign the user
PasswordResetsController PUT #update with valid token but invalid password should eq 422
PasswordResetsController PUT #update with valid token but invalid password should match /error/

testsuite.name: with valid token but missing password confirmation

testcase.name: PasswordResetsController PUT #update with valid token but missing password confirmation should assign the user
PasswordResetsController PUT #update with valid token but missing password confirmation should eq 422
PasswordResetsController PUT #update with valid token but missing password confirmation should match /error/

testsuite.name: with valid token but made too long ago

testcase.name: PasswordResetsController PUT #update with valid token but made too long ago should assign the user
PasswordResetsController PUT #update with valid token but made too long ago should eq 422
PasswordResetsController PUT #update with valid token but made too long ago should match /error/
PasswordResetsController PUT #update with valid token but made too long ago should match /expired/
PasswordResetsController PUT #update with invalid token should not assign the user
PasswordResetsController PUT #update with invalid token should eq 404
SessionsController POST #create with valid credentials should be success
SessionsController POST #create with valid credentials should eq {"user_email"=>"user@email.com", "auth_token"=>"token"}
SessionsController DELETE #destroy with valid credentials should be success
SessionsController POST #create with invalid credentials should eq 401
SessionsController DELETE #destroy with invalid credentials should eq 401
SessionsController POST #create with missing/invalid params should eq 422
